title: OKC's D lives up to 'identity' in dominant Game 1
content: Fueled by their No. 1-rated defense, the Thunder converted 19 Minnesota turnovers into 31 points and pulled away for a 114-88 win in Game 1.

title: Edwards optimistic Wolves will 'figure it out'
content: Despite his team being outscored by 30 points in the second half of a lopsided 114-88 Game 1 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder Tuesday night, Minnesota Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards was optimistic about Game 2, saying "I definitely got to shoot more."

title: Panthers use right 'recipe' again, crush Canes
content: Two days removed from eliminating the Maple Leafs in Toronto, the Florida Panthers kept their road show rolling Tuesday night, cruising past the Carolina Hurricanes 5-2 in Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals to improve to 9-4 this postseason.

title: Vikes' Jefferson dreams of winning Olympic gold
content: After NFL owners unanimously approved allowing the league's players to play flag football at the 2028 Olympics, Vikings star Justin Jefferson said the chance of winning a gold medal is "a dream."

title: Buehler tossed 3 innings into return; Cora too
content: Red Sox right-hander Walker Buehler, just back from the 15-day injured list, was ejected from Boston's 2-0 win on Tuesday over the New York Mets in the third inning for arguing balls and strikes, and moments later, manager Alex Cora was removed, as well.

title: Jeanty: OC wants me to ditch 'Halloween' stance
content: Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty says that offensive coordinator Chip Kelly wants him to adjust his pre-snap stance.

title: U.S. hockey star Knight says '26 Games her last
content: Hilary Knight, one of the most decorated players in women's hockey, told USA Today the 2026 Milan Winter Games will be her final Olympics.

title: üò≤ MLB's most surprising teams so far
content: We offer an early postseason verdict on five of MLB's most surprising teams almost two months into the 2025 season.

title: NFL stars and Olympic flag football: Why some are hesitant
content: A vote Tuesday paved the way for players such as Patrick Mahomes and Tyreek Hill to play Olympic flag football.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Minnesota on top, Golden State at the bottom in Week 1
content: Minnesota, New York and Indiana are 1-2-3 in Week 1, but which team climbed eight spots from our preseason rankings?

title: NBA conference finals: Everything to know about Knicks-Pacers, Thunder-Wolves series
content: With the NBA Finals just a round away, our experts break down how each team got here and what we are hearing about each series.

title: NBA conference finals horoscopes: Which teams are poised to ascend, and which will go in retrograde?
content: What does the Zodiac have to say about the Knicks, Thunder, Pacers and Wolves? Neil Paine shares his reading.

title: Chaos awaits in stacked SEC baseball tournament
content: For the very first time, all 16 SEC teams will get to participate in this year's conference baseball tournament.

title: No QBs allowed: We name the 25 best non-QB players for 2025
content: It's not all about quarterbacks. These players could have a big impact on 2025, even if they don't throw a pass.

title: Latest Bracketology: UConn emerges as a No. 1 seed for 2025-26
content: With Alex Karaban among the returning players, the Huskies crack the top line of our latest projected field.

title: Five fringe players who deserve a call-up for USMNT Gold Cup team
content: With results far from convincing, the USMNT needs fresh blood. Could these players get minutes at the Gold Cup?

title: Which Europa League finalist has had a worse season: Man United or Spurs?
content: Man United and Spurs have both had historically bad seasons but, somehow, one of them will win a European trophy and qualify for the Champions League.

title: Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft after the combine
content: The draft could get interesting at No. 3. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: How to bet tennis Grand Slams: The wagers you can make and ones to avoid
content: Tennis betting analyst Pam Maldonado reveals her strategies and tips for wagering on Grand Slam tournaments heading into the French Open.

title: Where things stand for each Ryder Cup team after two majors
content: Which players are locks to make each team? What tough decisions will captains Keegan Bradley and Luke Donald have to make? We break down how each team is shaping up.

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder favored to win championship, followed by Knicks
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP heading into the conference finals.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: 'Super-proud' De Bruyne: City sendoff felt 'weird'
content: Decorated Man City captain Kevin De Bruyne called his final game at City's home ground "weird" after he helped the team to 16 trophies since joining in 2015 -- a haul that includes six Premier League titles and the Champions League in 2023.

title: Ex-Sporting KC star Gadi Kinda dies at age 31
content: Former Sporting Kansas City midfielder Gadi Kinda died, his club Maccabi Haifa FC announced Tuesday. He was 31.

title: Poch: Turner risks being replaced as USMNT No. 1
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino said that he is open to giving playing time to another goalkeeper besides incumbent Matt Turner in upcoming matches ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: Pep tells Man City: Reduce squad size or I'll quit
content: Pep Guardiola said he would rather leave Manchester City than have to work with a bloated squad next season.

title: Sources: Guimar√£es targeted by Saudi champs
content: Newcastle United midfielder Bruno Guimar√£es is in the sights of Al Ittihad over a potential ‚Ç¨120 million ($135 million) transfer, sources confirmed to ESPN Brasil.

title: Amorim: 'Hard to explain' pressure on Postecoglou
content: Ruben Amorim said it's "hard to explain" why he is not under the same pressure at Manchester United as his Tottenham counterpart Ange Postecoglou ahead of the Europa League final despite both teams suffering similarly miserable Premier League campaigns.

title: Sources: Clubs sue Liga MX for pro/rel return
content: Mexican second division clubs from the Liga de Expansi√≥n have filed a lawsuit against Liga MX and the Mexican Football Federation (FMF) regarding the return of promotion of relegation, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: United closing in on $83m Cunha deal
content: Manchester United are growing increasingly confident that they will land Matheus Cunha from Wolves this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid plot move for Williams
content: Will Nico Williams become the latest Galactico at Real Madrid? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: YouTuber arrested for spying: Jyoti Malhotra's diary reveals troubling secrets
content: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, known for her cross-border travel videos, has been arrested on charges of spying for Pakistan. Haryana Police are scrutinizing her personal diary, revealing pro-Pakistan sentiments and contacts with Pakistani operatives. Investigators allege Malhotra shared sensitive information via encrypted platforms, using aliases to evade detection.

title: 'Chance up significantly': US intel on Israel preparing strike on Iran nuclears
content: US intelligence suggests Israel is increasing preparations for a potential military strike against Iranian nuclear facilities amid stalled US-Iran negotiations. These preparations, including repositioning munitions and air exercises, may also be a pressure tactic. An Israeli strike would sharply contrast with Trump's diplomatic approach and risk escalating the Middle East tensions, as Netanyahu navigates pressure to oppose a US-Iran deal.

title: IPL Playoff puzzle: What happens if MI vs DC gets washed out
content: A crucial IPL match between Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals at Wankhede Stadium faces a rain threat, potentially impacting playoff qualification hopes. Forecasts predict thunderstorms, which could lead to a washout, awarding each team one point. This scenario favors Mumbai, who can secure qualification by winning their final match, while Delhi's chances become more challenging, relying on other results.

title: BJP MP in Karnataka makes 'Work from Home' request to Infosys & other IT companies
content: Following heavy rainfall in Bengaluru, BJP MP PC Mohan urged IT companies like Infosys to allow work from home. Cognizant has already asked its Bengaluru employees to work from home. The city experienced the second-highest rainfall in a day since 2011, disrupting daily life and leading to the temporary closure of a section of Hosur Road due to waterlogging.

title: Bullet train project bets on European signalling tech; talks on for Japanese trainsets
content: India's bullet train project is advancing with a signalling and telecommunication system contract favouring European technology. A German-Indian consortium secured the lowest bid at ‚Çπ4,100 crore, significantly lower than a French-Indian competitor.

title: Maturity beyond age: Suryavanshi's heroic vs CSK shows he is not a fluke
content: Rajasthan Royals batting coach Vikram Rathour admits he was "sold" on Vaibhav Suryavanshi's talent after seeing him bat for the first time. The 14-year-old phenom further solidified that impression with a mature 33-ball 57 against CSK, anchoring a vital partnership. Rathour lauded Suryavanshi's temperament under pressure, suggesting his unique style and ability make him a truly special prospect.

title: Indian stabs another Indian to death in Texas bus
content: In Austin, Texas, Akshay Gupta, an Indian entrepreneur, was fatally stabbed on a CapMetro bus. Deepak Kandel, also of Indian origin, has been arrested and charged with murder. The incident occurred on May 14, 2025. Kandel reportedly stabbed Gupta without provocation. Police apprehended Kandel shortly after the incident. The community mourns Gupta's death and questions arise about public transport safety.

title: Elon Musk is 'killing' poor children, says Bill Gates; Tesla CEO responds: Who does ...
content: Bill Gates accused Elon Musk of endangering the lives of impoverished children by cutting foreign aid through his Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), leading to potential increases in measles, HIV, and polio cases. Musk dismissed Gates' claims as false, questioning Gates' judgment on childcare due to his past association with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Gujarat teen behind 50+ cyberattacks on govt websites during 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Gujarat ATS arrested Jasim Shahnawaz Ansari, an 18-year-old, for alleged cyber terrorism, including DDoS attacks on over 50 Indian government websites. Ansari, along with other juveniles, used tools learned online to target defense, finance, and aviation sites. The attacks intensified following India's Operation Sindoor, with anti-India messages posted after successful breaches.

title: 'Great son of India': PM Modi, Congress leaders pay tribute to Rajiv Gandhi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 34th death anniversary. Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, also offered homage at Veer Bhoomi. Rajiv Gandhi, who served as Prime Minister from 1984 to 1989, was assassinated in 1991. He was the country's youngest Prime Minister, assuming office at the age of 40.

title: Chipping away at ties: China slams US AI curbs, vows retaliation against ‚Äòbullying‚Äô
content: China has strongly criticised the US for its warnings against using Chinese AI chips, labelling the actions as protectionism that disrupts global tech supply chains. The US government's guidelines caution firms about potential export control violations when using semiconductors, particularly Huawei's Ascend AI chips. Beijing vowed to protect its interests amid ongoing US efforts to restrict China's access to advanced semiconductors.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: 'Diddy wore Muslim mask and watched': Stripper details alleged encounters
content: In the ongoing trial against Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs, prosecutors presented testimony from Sharay Hayes, a male stripper, detailing alleged encounters with Diddy and his ex-girlfriend Cassie. Hayes claimed he was hired multiple times for private performances, recounting one instance where a man, possibly Combs, watched while masked.

title: 'From bullock carts to global stage': Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize
content: Banu Mushtaq, a Kannada writer, has won the International Booker Prize 2025 for her short story collection, Heart Lamp, translated by Deepa Bhasthi. This marks the first time a short story collection has received this honor. The judging panel praised the work's radical translation and uplifting narratives, blending Kannada roots with socio-political themes.

title: IPL 2025: How many times have CSK finished bottom of IPL points table?
content: Chennai Super Kings are poised to finish at the bottom of the IPL standings after a dismal 2025 season marked by Ruturaj Gaikwad's injury and inconsistent performances. Despite a strong history with multiple titles and top-table finishes, their recent loss to Rajasthan Royals has nearly sealed their fate.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 crosses 24,900; BSE Sensex jumps 800 points
content: Indian stock markets surged on Wednesday, with the Nifty50 exceeding 24,900 and the BSE Sensex climbing 800 points. Market sentiment is cautious due to international developments, including US trade negotiations and rising US Treasury yields. Foreign investors turned net sellers, while domestic institutions bought.

title: Gold price prediction: Will it go below Rs 90,000?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices have exhibited volatility amidst global economic uncertainties, including concerns over US trade policies and a recent credit rating downgrade. Despite previous highs, prices retreated, influenced by a preliminary US-China trade agreement.

title: Andheri subway shut, roads flooded, traffic crawls: Rain throws Mumbai into chaos
content: Mumbai experienced heavy pre-monsoon showers on Tuesday evening, with Jogeshwari receiving the highest rainfall at 63mm. The IMD forecasts thunderstorms, lightning, and gusty winds up to 60kmph for Mumbai, Thane, Raigad, and Palghar districts throughout the week. Waterlogging shut down the Andheri subway, causing traffic congestion. Raigad is expected to face very heavy rainfall on Thursday and Friday.

title: MS Dhoni brutally roasted as netizens ask for IPL retirement
content: Chennai Super Kings face a potential last-place finish in IPL 2025, intensifying scrutiny on MS Dhoni, who returned as captain mid-season. Despite Dhoni's decent batting performance, CSK's struggles, including overseas players' underperformance and veterans' poor form, have led to defeats. A loss to Rajasthan Royals further compounded their woes, increasing pressure ahead of their final game against Gujarat Titans.

title: 'False campaign': Congress files FIR against BJP's Amit Malviya, Arnab Goswami
content: The Congress party has filed a police complaint against BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya and Republic TV's Arnab Goswami, accusing them of spreading misinformation. The FIR, lodged in Bengaluru, alleges that Malviya and Goswami falsely claimed the Istanbul Congress Centre is the Indian National Congress's office.

title: Dhoni's CSK just hit record low no one thought was possible
content: Rajasthan Royals defeated Chennai Super Kings by six wickets, chasing down 188 at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Vaibhav Suryavanshi's impressive 57 off 33 balls and Yashasvi Jaiswal's quick 36 set the stage for the victory. CSK's batting inconsistency, despite Ayush Mhatre's 43, led to their fifth loss while defending a total, increasing the risk of finishing last.

title: Jayant Narlikar: Indian astrophysicist who went beyond Big Bang
content: Jayant Narlikar, born in 1938, challenged established cosmological theories and championed science education in India. Collaborating with Fred Hoyle, he developed an alternative to the Big Bang Theory. Narlikar returned to India to build research institutions like IUCAA and reformed science textbooks, striving to make science accessible and fostering scientific curiosity among the public.

title: Man charred to death as chariot strikes power lines in Tamil Nadu
content: A tragic accident in Orathy village, Chengalpet district, resulted in the death of 28-year-old Rajkumar, a tractor driver, when a temple chariot he was operating came into contact with overhead power lines during a religious procession. The iron chariot, adorned with decorations, caught fire instantly, also severely burning four other devotees.

title: Internet reacts after 14-yo Vaibhav Suryavanshi touches MS Dhoni's feet
content: Following Rajasthan Royals' victory over Chennai Super Kings, young batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, known for his record-breaking century, displayed remarkable respect by touching MS Dhoni's feet. This heartwarming gesture resonated deeply with fans, overshadowing the match's playoff implications. Suryavanshi's humility and talent continue to impress, marking him as a rising star in cricket.

title: Trump says Biden's 'cognitive decline' was exploited to let criminals into US
content: Donald Trump accused the Biden administration of treason for an open-border policy, alleging it allowed criminals into the US due to Biden's cognitive decline. Trump claimed it was Biden's staff who implemented the policy, deliberately undermining the country and costing billions. He warned of severe consequences for these actions, accusing them of stealing the presidency.

title: Dhoni warns young batters: 'If you're looking for 200-plus SR then ... '
content: MS Dhoni advised young Indian batters like Vaibhav Suryavanshi to maintain consistency and stay calm under pressure. Despite CSK's loss to RR, Dhoni acknowledged early wickets put pressure on the team. Sanju Samson praised Suryavanshi's mature innings and game awareness, highlighting his promising future and the coaching staff's role in developing young talents.

title: 'I would've loved to see Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma play more'
content: Indian cricket faces a significant transition as Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Ravichandran Ashwin retire from Test cricket. Vikram Rathour acknowledges their immense contributions and respects their decisions. Ashwin reflects on their careers, highlighting Kohli's aggression and Rohit's potential. Meanwhile, young Vaibhav Suryavanshi shines in the IPL, scoring a match-winning half-century for Rajasthan Royals.

title: May consider new sanctions on Russia if peace talks stall: US
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio defended President Trump's Ukraine policy, asserting that Russia had not gained any concessions. This statement countered Senator Jeanne Shaheen's criticism that Trump's actions emboldened Putin. Rubio indicated that sanctions might be necessary if Russia continued military operations and showed no interest in peace negotiations, while Trump expressed confidence in Putin's desire for peace.

title: New law designed to rob Muslims of religious rights over waqf: Kapil Sibal
content: When the CJI said courts prima facie presume a law enacted by Parliament to be valid, Sibal said Waqf Amendment Act was discriminatory as it had singled out the Muslim community by mandating that a waqif has to be a practising Muslim for five years to be entitled to donate his properties for waqf. "Has any other religious denomination been mandated by law to ask the same question to anyone making an endowment for charitable purposes?" he asked.

title: Heart Lamp by Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize 2025
content: Banu Mushtaq, a Kannada writer, has been awarded the International Booker Prize 2025 for her short story collection, Heart Lamp. Deepa Bhasthi translated the book from Kannada to English. After becoming the first Kannada author to win the International Booker Prize, Banu told TOI: ‚ÄúThis prize shows the true potential of the Kannada language, its literature, and the possibilities ahead if more works are translated into other languages, especially English.‚Äù

title: ONGC, Jubilant & more: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' Mehul Kothari recommends buying Chennai Petro, Jubilant Pharmova, and ONGC. Chennai Petro shows a breakout with a target of ‚Çπ870, while Jubilant Pharmova indicates bullish momentum targeting ‚Çπ1060. ONGC has reclaimed its 200 DEMA, suggesting strength with a short-term target of ‚Çπ260.

title: George Wendt dies at 76: Social media remembers the ‚ÄòCheers‚Äô star
content: George Wendt, celebrated for his iconic role as Norm Peterson on Cheers, passed away peacefully at 76 on May 20, 2025. His portrayal of the affable bar regular earned him six Emmy nominations and a permanent place in television history. Wendt's Cheers co-stars, including Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman, fondly remembered him.

title: ED conducts multi-city raids in money laundering case
content: The Enforcement Directorate seized foreign currencies, including U.S. Dollars, Singapore Dollars and Dirhams, amounting to around ‚Çπ6.43 lakh, gold bullion worth ‚Çπ55.74 lakh, and froze bank accounts with a total balance of around ‚Çπ94 lakh

title: Kerala CM‚Äôs office dismisses reports of credit row between Ministers behind Pinarayi‚Äôs absence at Smart City road inauguration
content: Controversy erupts after reports that Public Works department, headed by P.A. Mohamad Riyas, usurped claim for successful completion of Centre‚Äôs project hugely underwritten by Local Self-Government department, headed by M.B. Rajesh

title: Six, including four of a family from Telangana, killed in road accident
content: The SUV vehicle travelling towards Solapur jumped the median and collided with a private bus coming from Mumbai to Ballari on the National Highway 50.

title: Kerala govt. to establish model degree college in Wayanad
content: The institution will come up on a five-acre plot of land at Thrissilery village in Mananthavady, which has been transferred from the General Education department for the purpose.

title: Prima facie case against Sonia, Rahul made out: ED tells court in National Herald matter
content: The ED made the submission before special judge Vishal Gogne during the opening submissions on whether to take cognisance of the matter

title: FIR against unknown person for recording women in Bengaluru metro train
content: The objectionable videos were deleted and police are working to get the account suspended. Efforts are on to track the account holder

title: PM Modi thought of sending delegations to divert attention from tough questions: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: ‚ÄúSince the 1950s, MPs from various political parties have been sent in delegations to the UN in New York every October-November and PM Modi stopped this tradition from 2014,‚Äù Jairam Ramesh said

title: Encounter breaks out between security forces, Maoists in Chhattisgarh‚Äôs Narayanpur
content: Maoists opened fire when teams of District Reserve Guards of police from four districts were out on an operation in Abhujmad area

title: DMK‚Äôs expelled youth wing office-bearer seeks anticipatory bail in sexual harassment case
content: A 20-year-old college student had lodged a complaint accusing him of having married her under threat and coercion and subjecting her to physical torture

title: Malaysia Masters: Prannoy, Karunakaran register upset wins; Sindhu exits
content: H.S. Prannoy stuns fifth seed Kenta Nishimoto of Japan; Satish Karunakaran stuns third seed Chou Tien Chen of Chinese Taipei

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka rains LIVE: Rain lashes parts of Mumbai; red alert in Karnataka
content: The India Meteorological Department predicts possibility of thunderstorms and moderate-to-heavy rains in Mumbai on Wednesday, May 21, 2025; changes warning to red alert in 7 districts of Karnataka

title: Trump tax on remittances could hurt India, but flows from other countries might limit damage
content: If a new legislation introduced by US President Donald Trump, called the ‚ÄúOne Big Beautiful Bill Act‚Äù, is passed, it could see sweeping changes to that country‚Äôs income tax, healthcare, corporate tax, and national debt level regulations.

title: UCO Bank chairperson ‚Äòdiverted, siphoned‚Äô funds worth over ‚Çπ6,000 crores: ED
content: The ED investigation revealed that during his tenure as the CMD of UCO Bank, UCO Bank had sanctioned large credit facilities to Concast Steep & Power Ltd, and received various illegal gratifications from shell entities linked to the company.

title: Booker Prize for Banu Mushtaq: Here‚Äôs how political leaders, Kannada writers and readers reacted to Heart Lamp‚Äôs win
content: Writer, activist and lawyer¬†Banu Mushtaq‚Äòs short story collection ‚ÄòHeart Lamp‚Äô became the¬†first Kannada title¬†to win the International Booker Prize

title: Tamil Nadu sues Centre in Supreme Court over non-disbursal of ‚Çπ2,000-crore education funds
content: The State submits the lack of funds would affect 43,94,906 students, 2,21,817 teachers in Tamil Nadu and also says Centre‚Äôs refusal to provide crucial funds linked to the State‚Äôs objection to the three-language formula of NEP-2020

title: Waqf (Amendment) Act hearing LIVE:  No eviction from waqf property until entire judicial process of review is completed: Centre
content: Underscoring the ‚Äúpresumption of constitutionality in favour of law‚Äù, the top court on May 20 said petitioners challenging the waqf law needed a ‚Äústrong and glaring‚Äù case for interim relief

title: The 3-year rule: a setback to judiciary aspirants
content: The Supreme Court‚Äôs hope is that three years‚Äô of practice may help future judges in addressing courtroom decorum, complex procedural cases and in understanding the perspectives of all stakeholders of the judicial system

title: Stand united in fight against terrorism: PM Modi in talks with new German Chancellor
content: The Ministry of External Affairs says that during the telephone conversation, the two leaders ‚Äòreiterated their shared commitment to combating terrorism in all its forms‚Äô

title: Bengal CM Mamata disburses second tranche of Banglar Bari to 12 lakh beneficiaries
content: The Chief Minister highlights housing and welfare initiatives, targets BJP over tea garden promises in North Bengal

title: Murshidabad violence: Calcutta¬†High Court-appointed panel says police were inactive at some places
content: Noting that the ‚Äúmain attack‚Äù occurred on the afternoon of April 11, the report by the three-member committee said ‚ÄúLocal police were completely inactive and absent‚Äù

title: Jharkhand IAS officer Vinay Kumar Choubey arrested in excise scam, sent to judicial custody
content: Jharkhand IAS officer arrested in ‚Çπ38 crore money laundering case linked to excise scam, sparking demands for CBI probe

title: Rain lashes parts of Mumbai, more showers forecast in Maharashtra till May 24
content: Heavy rainfall and thunderstorm hit Mumbai, causing traffic disruptions, with more rain expected in Maharashtra in coming days

title: Kurnool-Vijayawada flight services to start from July 2
content: The flight services between the two cities would be available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays initially. The services would run on daily basis from a later date.

title: Cabinet clears proposals to allot land to APIIC, Bhogapuram airport, recruitment of teachers
content: The Cabinet approved to shift the Potti Sreeramulu Telugu University from Hyderabad to Andhra Pradesh.

title: A.P. CM Naidu tells his Cabinet colleagues to refrain from commenting on liquor scam
content: Probe agencies should be given a free hand to do their job, he says; six-member Sub-Committee to monitor prices of farm produces and essential commodities.

title: TTD trust Board decides to increase green cover in Tirumala to 80%, improve infrastructure
content: The Trust Board gives nod to invite proposals for a master plan for developing temples at Tiruchanoor, Amaravati, Narayanavanam, Kapilatheertham, Nagalapuram, and Vontimitta

title: Kurma mela: The science of the mass nesting of Olive Ridley turtles¬†
content: Olive Ridley turtles have endured mass extinctions, shifting continents, and rising seas. Their resilience is remarkable ‚Äî but not limitless

title: Singareni aims for 76 mt coal production this year, asks young officers to fit into future plans
content: CMD N. Balaram asks young officers to aim bringing down coal price by at least ‚Çπ1K per tonne to be competitive by improving production, productivity

title: Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize for Kannada short story collection ‚ÄòHeart Lamp‚Äô
content: Mushtaq described her win as a victory for diversity as she collected the prize at‚ÄØa ceremony at Tate Modern‚ÄØalong with her translator Deepa Bhasthi

title: Delhi Metro's Blue Line Services Delayed Due To Technical Snag
content: Services on Delhi Metro's Blue Line between Dwarka and Janakpuri West were delayed on Wednesday morning due to a technical snag, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said.

title: Case Against Instagram Account For Sharing Unsolicited Pics Of Women On Bengaluru Metro
content: An FIR has been registered against unknown persons after a social media account was found to be sharing photographs of women commuters on Bengaluru's metro rail system without their consent.

title: Meet Tesla's Indian-Origin Exec Who Earned A Record Rs 1,157 Crore In 2024
content: Tesla CFO Vaibhav Taneja's base salary stood at around Rs 3.33 crore, but the total compensation far exceeded that of Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and Alphabet Chief Sundar Pichai.

title: Opinion: Opinion| Apple Desperately Needs The AI Help It's Seeking
content: If you read Bloomberg Businessweek's deep dive into Apple's blundering work with artificial intelligence, a consistent theme is the lack of any clear idea within the company as to what good AI on an Apple device should actually do.

title: In A First, Alzheimer's Blood Test Available in US From June
content: The first blood test to help diagnose Alzheimer's disease will be available from late June in the US following regulatory clearance for its use last week, according to the Japanese company behind the innovation.

title: Exotic Dancer 'The Punisher' Tells Court How He Found Diddy's Identity
content: An exotic dancer by the name "The Punisher" has revealed the moment he realised he had been hired by music mogul Sean Diddy Combs to perform alongside his former partner Cassie Ventura

title: 'Spy' YouTuber's Bangladesh Connection Emerges, She Was Planning A Visit
content: As the investigation into YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra's alleged espionage for Pakistan proceeds, her fresh links with Bangladesh seem to have emerged, thereby bringing her under greater suspicion and scrutiny by the agencies.

title: Op Sindoor Outreach Begins, These MPs Take India's Message To Japan, UAE
content: India's global outreach to brief world powers on Operation Sindoor and expose Pakistan's link to terror begins today. Two of the seven delegations will begin the journey to their respective destinations today.

title: Gemini AI App Crosses 400 Million Monthly Active Users
content: The Gemini app now has over 400 million monthly active users and we are seeing strong growth and engagement, particularly with the 2.5 series of AI models, Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Alphabet, has said.

title: US Man Plotted To Kill His Romantic Rival, Then Feed Body To Pigs
content: A New York man planned a murder-for-hire plot against his romantic rival and wanted to feed his remains to pigs.

title: Asiatic Lion Population In Gujarat Rises To 891 From 674 In Five Years
content: The estimated population of Asiatic lions in Gujarat has increased to 891 against 674 five years ago as per the census conducted this month, Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel announced on Wednesday.

title: Delhi Records Highest Minimum Temperature This Summer At 30.2 Celcius
content: Delhi on Wednesday recorded the highest minimum temperature of the season so far at 30.2 degrees Celsius, 3.5 degrees above normal.

title: Why India Picked These 33 Countries For Global Anti-Terror Outreach
content: A massive diplomatic initiative by India to reach out to nearly three dozen countries with a message against terrorism in the aftermath of the Pahalgam attack begins today.

title: NEP Row: Tamil Nadu Government Moves Supreme Court Against Centre
content: The Tamil Nadu government has filed a petition before the Supreme Court against the Government of India for allegedly withholding funds after the state government decided not to implement the New Education Policy, 2020

title: Sensex Up 267 Points, Market Bounce Back On Buying In Bank Stocks
content: Stock market benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty rebounded in early trade on Wednesday after heavy drubbing in the previous session amid buying in blue-chip bank stocks and a firm trend in Asian peers.

title: Before Asim Munir, Pakistan Only Had 1 Field Marshal. He Became A Dictator
content: Pakistan's first and only other Field Marshal Muhammad Ayub Khan rose to absolute power more than six decades ago.

title: Lashkar-e-Taiba Co-Founder Amir Hamza Injured At Lahore Home, Hospitalised
content: Amir Hamza, cofounder and senior leader of the terrorist group Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), was hospitalised in Pakistan's Lahore following injuries sustained at his residence, sources said.

title: Iran Faces US Without Plan B As Nuclear Red Lines Collide
content: While rising US-Iran tensions over Tehran's uranium enrichment jeopardize nuclear talks, three Iranian sources said that the clerical leadership lacks a clear fallback plan if efforts to resolve a decades-long dispute collapse.

title: Ahead Of Indian Astronaut's Space Odyssey, A Global Outreach
content: India and the US are using the upcoming NASA-ISRO joint flight of an Indian astronaut to space as a big outreach activity between the world's oldest and world's largest democracies.

title: PM Modi Pays Tributes To Rajiv Gandhi On Death Anniversary
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday paid tributes to former prime minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 34th death anniversary.

title: SC to petitioners on waqf law: Need 'strong and glaring' case for interim relief
content: The Supreme Court has asked petitioners challenging the waqf laws to present a compelling case for interim relief, emphasizing the presumption of constitutionality for statutes. Petitioners argue the law enables systematic expropriation of waqf properties, dilutes Muslim representation, and restricts legal remedies.

title: Promote harmony, study impact of AI on workers: SCO‚Äôs trade union leaders
content: The meeting of trade union leaders also decided to promote cultural exchanges among SCO member countries

title: Madrasa students in Uttarakhand to study Operation Sindoor in their syllabus
content: Mufti Shamoon Qasmi, President of the Uttarakhand Madrasa Education Council, says the step is aimed at instilling a sense of patriotism among students of madrasas; the State has around 50,000 students in its 450-odd madrasas

title: Conditions favourable for advance of southwest monsoon: RMC
content: Light to moderate rain is likely to occur over isolated places in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Karaikal area till May 26

title: How¬†Jayalalithaa gave up opposition to nuclear plant, citing¬†Srinivasan‚Äôs report
content: After pitching for the¬†Kudankulam project, the Chief Minister urged the Centre in September 2011 to halt it until apprehensions about its safety were addressed.¬†Yet she set up an expert panel in February 2012. It included former Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission¬†M.R.¬†Srinivasan. Based on its report, she green-lighted the plant in March

content: 2025 is the unofficial end point of the bonus year . if you're Diego Pavia, who might play until he's eligible to collect social security . some of last season's rules allowed players to stick around for five, six or even seven years .

title: Panthers win big: Grades for both teams, players to watch for Game 2
content: the Florida Panthers beat the Carolina Hurricanes 5-2 in game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals . one team had four days to prepare, the other barely had 48 hours . a second-period lead led to the Panthers winning their 28th straight playoff game in which they led after two frames .

title: Fever fail to handle Dream's 'physicality' in loss
content: the Atlanta Dream went 5-1 against the WNBA last season . the dream also have a new coach this season in Karl Smesko . it's unclear what opponents will try to do against the Fever in a playoff series .

title: Eight things we learned from the WNBA's opening weekend
content: the 2025 WNBA season is off and running . there's only so much to take away from a small sample size of games to begin the grind . some slow starts can turn around -- see the Fever last season making the playoffs after opening 1-8 .

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander leads Thunder to win
content: the 2025 NBA conference finals have tipped off, with four teams fighting for a spot in the finals . the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder defeated the visiting no. 6 seed Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 1 . in the East, the new york Knicks will take on the No. 4 seed Indiana Pacers on Wednesday .
